contentrichtext.text: '''[[Paisley]]''' is a town in Renfrewshire, Scotland. It may also refer to: {{TOCright}} ==Fashion and design== *[[Paisley (design)]], a pattern or motif popularised by the Scottish town of Paisley ==Places== *[[Paisley Grammar School]], a royal chartered Secondary School in Paisley, Renfrewshire *The [[Diocese of Paisley]], a territory of the Roman Catholic Church in Scotland *[[Paisley, Florida]], United States *[[Paisley, Oregon]], United States *[[Paisley Caves]], Oregon, United States *[[Paisley, Ontario]], Canada *[[Paisley, Edmonton]], Alberta, Canada ==Politics== *[[Paisley (UK Parliament constituency)]], corresponding to the Scottish town ==People== *[[Lord Paisley]], Scottish nobleman *[[Bob Paisley]], football manager *[[Brad Paisley]], country singer *[[Doug Paisley]], folk singer *[[Eileen Paisley, Baroness Paisley of St George's]] *[[GrÃ©gory Paisley]], French footballer *[[Ian Paisley]], Northern Ireland politician and church leader (b. 1926) *[[Ian Paisley, Jr.]], Northern Ireland politician (b. 1966) *[[Jackie Paisley]], American female bodybuilder *[[John Paisley (actor)]], a Scottish actor working in China *[[John Paisley]], John Arthur Paisley, a former CIA officer *[[Paisley Currah]], Canadian transgender academic *The stage name of [[Sharmell Sullivan-Huffman]] in World Championship Wrestling ==Music== *[[Paisley Underground]], a style of 1960s influenced music, usually associated with the Los Angeles music scene of the 1980s *[[Paisley Park]], a record label owned by the musician Prince. ==Animals== *[[Paisley Terrier]] was a breed of dog, ancestor of the Yorkshire Terrier {{disambiguation}}
